{"model":"claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929","max_tokens":8192,"thinking":{"type":"enabled","budget_tokens":8191},"stream":true,"system":"You are a helpfull assistant who answers questions succinctly. Please use the calculator tool when asked mathematical questions.","messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is 3 * 5?"}]}],"tools":[{"name":"calculator","description":"# Calculator
The claculator DSL evaluates math, comparisons, logic, and numeric aggregates.
## Numbers
- Integers and floats are accepted.
- Bitwise operators use integers; non-integers are truncated.
- The result of bitwise operators are non-numeric but can be converted to numeric using ROUND.
## Arithmetic operators
- + (add), - (subtract), * (multiply), / (divide), % (modulo), ^ (power).
- Bitwise: | (or), & (and), << (shift left), >> (shift right).
## Math Functions
- SIN, COS, TAN, ASIN, ACOS, ATAN, ATAN2, SINH, COSH, TANH, ASINH, ACOSH, ATANH,   SQRT, EXP, LOG, LOG10, POW.
- Angles are in radians.
## Comparison Operators
- =, !=, <>, <, >, <=, >= return booleans.
## Logical functions
- IF(cond, then, else).
- AND(a, b, ...), OR(a, b, ...), XOR(a, b), NOT(x).
- XOR(a, b) is true if exactly one argument is true.
## Numeric Functions
- MIN(...), MAX(...), SUM(...), AVG(...), COUNT(...).
- ROUND(x, [digits]).
- ROUNDDOWN(x, [digits]) rounds toward zero.
- ROUNDUP(x, [digits]) rounds away from zero.
- ABS(x).
## Constants
- PI, E## Aggregates
- Functions accept a list of values or an array, e.g., SUM(1,2,3) or
  SUM(1,2,3).
- COUNT counts non-nil numeric arguments.
## Operator precedence (high to low)
1) Parentheses and functions
2) Unary +, unary -, NOT
3) ^
4) *, /, %
5) +, -
6) <<, >>
7) &
8) |
9) Comparisons (=, !=, <>, <, >, <=, >=)
10) AND, XOR, OR
## Errors and Edge Cases
- Division by zero raises an error.
- Non-numeric values in numeric functions raise an error.
- Mismatched list sizes in INTERCEPT raise an error.
","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"expression":{"type":"string","description":"Formula to evaluate. Examples: 
- 1 + 2 * 3 -> 7
- ^ is power: 2 ^ 3 -> 8
- Bitwise: 5 | 2 -> 7, 5 & 2 -> 0, 5 << 1 -> 10
- Trig: SIN(PI/2) -> 1
- IF(2 > 1, 10, 0) -> 10
- ROUND(3.14159, 2) -> 3.14; ROUNDUP(-1.2) -> -1; ROUNDDOWN(1.9) -> 1
- AVG(1,2,3,4) -> 2.5
"}},"required":["expression"]}}]}

{"model":"claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929","max_tokens":8192,"thinking":{"type":"enabled","budget_tokens":8191},"stream":true,"system":"You are a helpfull assistant who answers questions succinctly. I should use the calculator tool to compute this.","signature":""},{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_017RQHF2TNdpx58cR8vBBBvo","name":"calculator","input":{"expression":"3 * 5"}}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"tool_result","tool_use_id":"toolu_017RQHF2TNdpx58cR8vBBBvo","content":"15"}]}],"tools":[{"name":"calculator","description":"# Calculator
The claculator DSL evaluates math, comparisons, logic, and numeric aggregates.
## Numbers
- Integers and floats are accepted.
- Bitwise operators use integers; non-integers are truncated.
- The result of bitwise operators are non-numeric but can be converted to numeric using ROUND.
## Arithmetic operators
- + (add), - (subtract), * (multiply), / (divide), % (modulo), ^ (power).
- Bitwise: | (or), & (and), << (shift left), >> (shift right).
## Math Functions
- SIN, COS, TAN, ASIN, ACOS, ATAN, ATAN2, SINH, COSH, TANH, ASINH, ACOSH, ATANH,   SQRT, EXP, LOG, LOG10, POW.
- Angles are in radians.
## Comparison Operators
- =, !=, <>, <, >, <=, >= return booleans.
## Logical functions
- IF(cond, then, else).
- AND(a, b, ...), OR(a, b, ...), XOR(a, b), NOT(x).
- XOR(a, b) is true if exactly one argument is true.
## Numeric Functions
- MIN(...), MAX(...), SUM(...), AVG(...), COUNT(...).
- ROUND(x, [digits]).
- ROUNDDOWN(x, [digits]) rounds toward zero.
- ROUNDUP(x, [digits]) rounds away from zero.
- ABS(x).
## Constants
- PI, E## Aggregates
- Functions accept a list of values or an array, e.g., SUM(1,2,3) or
  SUM(1,2,3).
- COUNT counts non-nil numeric arguments.
## Operator precedence (high to low)
1) Parentheses and functions
2) Unary +, unary -, NOT
3) ^
4) *, /, %
5) +, -
6) <<, >>
7) &
8) |
9) Comparisons (=, !=, <>, <, >, <=, >=)
10) AND, XOR, OR
## Errors and Edge Cases
- Division by zero raises an error.
- Non-numeric values in numeric functions raise an error.
- Mismatched list sizes in INTERCEPT raise an error.
","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"expression":{"type":"string","description":"Formula to evaluate. Examples: 
- 1 + 2 * 3 -> 7
- ^ is power: 2 ^ 3 -> 8
- Bitwise: 5 | 2 -> 7, 5 & 2 -> 0, 5 << 1 -> 10
- Trig: SIN(PI/2) -> 1
- IF(2 > 1, 10, 0) -> 10
- ROUND(3.14159, 2) -> 3.14; ROUNDUP(-1.2) -> -1; ROUNDDOWN(1.9) -> 1
- AVG(1,2,3,4) -> 2.5
"}},"required":["expression"]}}]}
